title: What a Hilton should represent
text: I really liked this Hilton hotel. Stayed here for only one night unfortunately but I moved into the city centre for the rest of my stay in Istanbul. It's a great place for concert goers to the VW Arena, which is where I was working. Great staff and amenities.

title: Modern concert venue
text: Worked here last summer on a show and great staff but the backstage facilities could be upgraded somewhat

title: What a great city
text: Having never visited Ankara before now I was intrigued to be there for 24 hours back last summer. The modern look and architecture was a joy and driving around this city was a pleasure. The Hilton was no exception with great staff and service.

title: Great location for a business trip
text: I stayed here for 2 nights last year on business. The staff were great and the room very comfortable. They have a nice little bar down in the reception area and although I didn't eat in their restaurant, I remember the breakfasts were fab. Would return here.

title: Check out the Herodian theatre if you can
text: This theatre, the oldest in the world, 5000 capacity and originally with a wooden roof, dates back 2000 years and built id 161AD

title: Back in time
text: The floor of this place is like no other place I have ever visited. The ruins of another age beneath your feet, and the exhibits inside take you to times you cannot imagine, just beautiful and thank goodness because Athens itself isn't the greatest city on the planet

title: Walk to the Acropolis and Museum in minutes
text: Great location for a concert at the Herodian Theatre which is where I was working for this trip. The hotel staff were fantastic and the breakfast room in the basement excellent. Had an early departure, 5.00am but the staff still let us have a coffee and a sandwich.

title: Great location for the city
text: Loved this hotel, staff were great, and a fab bar on the roof with a small pool. Loads of restaurants surrounding the hotel to chose from and the water a stone's throw away. It's a shame there isn't a beach too!

title: Disappointing hotel for a weeks holiday
text:
You can see from the photo that the first few minutes after we were shown to the room we had booked for our 5 day holiday I was absolutely livid, angry, upset. I demanded a new room, and the only one on offer was the best suite in the hotel. So a few hundred euros later we had a decent room, but still I've got a complaint about it. It is situated behind the bar, the bedroom door is NOT thick enough to prevent you hearing the chatter at the bar.
Thank goodness the weather was good and the beach at the bottom of the road was fabulous
The hotel staff were lovely, the food there was great but guys you have no real idea how to treat your guests if you think putting them in rooms looking out over a building site is acceptable. We won't be back

title: Perfect for a concert night
text: Working at Cardiff Arena as I have a few times, this hotel is so convenient at midnight to just stroll over the road and fall into bed. The inner rooms I'd avoid as some of them connect into the Atrium and the bar there doesn't close early!

title: 5* chill space on the beach
text: Thank you Leni for being a super host. The accommodation was devine and with temps getting quite hot, the excellent AC day and night kept us so comfortable. The Lennon Maison private beach area, across the track from the room gave us just the privacy we were looking for and a selection of restaurants within walking distance was perfect too. Good luck for the rest of 2020 Leni and stay safe. Thanks from Richard and Carrie

title: Cosy night's sleep
text:
After staying in a terrible hotel up north earlier this week, a brief stay of one night here again did not disappoint. Arrived at 1am and the receptionist swiftly got me registered and up to my room. Simple parking under the hotel makes life easier and since my first visit 18 months ago they have signage up to identify the hotel in the dark..... hurray
Very cosy bed and duvet, great breakfast selection and before I knew it I was off again to another destination

title: So so tired
text:
If there is a place that needed a facelift, this is one in desperate need
Stayed here three nights last week and couldn't wait to leave the place
The bed was hard and uncomfortable, the duvet too thin so got cold in the middle of the night. The key didn't work both nights I returned late from working.
The newspaper ordered for the morning didn't show up.
The restaurant was full on wednesday night and turned me away, The sandwich I ordered from room service took an hour to arrive
place: Mercure Manchester Norton Grange Hotel & Spa

title: A hidden gem behind the shop
text: It was at first a typical wine shop but as one walked further into the establishment the back of the store was covered in huge old wine barrels with stools around them. The tapas was some of the best we have ever eaten, each dish cooked to order from a tiny kitchen area. One could buy a bottle of wine in the front of the shop and drink it at the table with different tapas or order by the glass. A must try if visiting Alella. Great service too....

title: Meet the locals
text: As well as an amazing wine shop the likes I have never seen before, the bar was great. We arrived to watch the place fill up with a lot of local people, and we tried a couple of different tapas dishes, which were tasty. I loved the local sauces that they covered a packet of crisps over in a bowl and their beer and wines were lovely and good value

title: Great country pub near Oxford
text: I love the renovations that this pub has had in the recent past. I also liked the response time on online ordering for a recent christmas get together with my family. Once there the menu is up to date and the beers behind the bar tasty. I'd recommend anyone in the Oxford area to go check this pub out for a lunch or dinner.

title: Though it would be better
text:
So we arrived and checked in, given our key and off we walked, quite a distance across the car park to our room. It wasn't ready ! Nothing done since the last guests were there. So back we traipsed to reception. They were nice, gave us a free drink and I had one of the best sandwiches in a long time, while we waited for our room.
Off to the spa later, that was nice, a steam room and jacucci, it was a thursday afternoon and not at all crowded. We went out for dinner and back at the hotel, unfortunately the room had a high pitched buzz coming from some equipment in a cupboard across the hallway from our bedroom door. All the staff were lovely, it's the room that disappointed most, it was not as nice as a premier inn for double the money

title: Harbourside dining with a cool room
text: So it's brilliant that the hotel sits next to a NCP car park with direct access to the hotel. Get a voucher from reception and it's 5 pounds for 24 hours. Then we asked for a harbour view and was upgraded so that was cool. Decided to eat at the hotel restaurant, as the menu looked great, and we were not disappointed, the staff and the service was spot on and the food excellent. I can't fault it. We're coming back, we loved our one night stay there

title: Excellent Fare
text: What a fantastic pub/restaurant this place really is, the service and the staff were top notch and then there was the dinner. I wanted to eat everything on this menu, and if I lived closer I surely would have by now, several times. Full marks to the team in that kitchen, all 4 of us loved ever mouthful.

title: Great location
text: A two minute walk to the bus stop direct into the city centre. Our room was lovely, looking over the Banbury road and had everything you'd need for a one night stop over. The staff were very helpful and the internet is free. In the morning, the breakfast room was busy but breakfast was generally uninspiring, a bit more thought could go into making it a better experience. But I'd recommend this B and B to anyone.

title: If your hungry this is the place to come
text: I couldn't believe how big this place was, down the escalator into a vast room of food, and more food. It takes some time to just peruse the variety of dishes that this restaurant has to offer. There is an asian section of japanese indian and chinese dishes, then there is the italian and the english roast sections. But it's an all you can eat experience for a one off and it's not the most brilliant quality.

title: Very tasty Tapas
text: We dropped in for lunch and were not disappointed. The dishes were a decent size and all were delicious. Great vibe and great staff, will definitely come back here.

title: second class business
text: Why does the airline advertise a business class seat and you end up on a plane that has exactly the same configuration of seating throughout the whole plane. No difference in legroom, the only reason I fly business!

title: Stockholm room with a sauna !
text: Great staff..... so helpful. Changed our room after requesting a bigger one for a 4 night stay, ended upgraded the first night then switched to a bigger room for the other three nights, with a sauna in the bathroom. Great breakfasts and excellent location to walk anywhere in the city centre. The thursday night jazz was good and I'd recommend a stay there.

title: So easy to get to and from the airport
text: 20 minutes to downtown from the airport and fast, clean and easy. I do wish we'd arrived in daylight as I'd liked to have seen a bit of the countryside but he ho !

title: Like eating lunch in a tube station
text: The table next to the staff ordering station. I reckon at 4 staff members per minute passing one foot away from our table we must have had 240 people pass us while we were trying to eat our lunch! A sunday lunch for my 90 year old mother....man ooh man why do you even have this table to serve food on, it's just awful. Every other table in this lovely pub has no real foot traffic going passed it, every other table......... Stop being so greedy and get rid of it, the place was packed on sunday, you don't need to piss off people by having them have to sit at this table.

title: My 65th birthday dinner
text: I loved it, the food is spot on and we really had a nice evening there. I ate a veal t-bone which was perfectly cooked, my wife had the house special which is a veal mousse meatball. The wines were excellent, with my first experience of Austrian red wine, very nice, if a little expensive, but hey, only 65 once!

title: Gotta try the meatballs in Stockholm !
text: Well you can't go to Sweden without seeing what the competition is like compared to Ikea now can you? So after much investigation we took a tube ride to the island pasted Gamla Stan and queued up for 20 minutes or so to get a table. I didn't mind, the beer there is great and finally sat down to meatballs mash and vegetables. You know our sausages and mash are in the same league in a good restaurant or pub, so it's kinda like that really.

title: Room with a view
text: A great view at that. I was on the 15th floor I think, upgraded as I was working over the road at the Hydro. The members floor has a special lounge, free drinks and nibbles. It was packed so I avoided that and just took in the city from on high. Breakfast was very nice, good buffet. I wished I was staying there another night. Very comfortable bed zzz

title: Difficut to find at night
text:
Please put up a sign somewhere off the main road. It is located in a new housing estate. The sat nav was confused as the road is new. The hotel needs signage badly.
The positive is the room, very comfy bed, slept like a log. Breakfast was fine, staff friendly.

title: Perfect city break
text: I like this hotel, it is in a great location, it will eventually be surrounded by new buildings, but right now its in the middle of a huge building site. It is walking distance to everything in central Manchester. We walked the whole city for 2 days and fell back into our cosy room to relax. The breakfast bar is good and there is parking right outside the front door. I have to praise the staff as well as I left a dvd player there by mistake and a week later the duty manager located it and sent it back to me foc. The only downside was the thickness of the party walls. You can hear your neighbour so fingers crossed they go to bed early, as ours were from the states and seemed to skype half the night.

title: A great way to spend a couple of hours
text: We loved it, and there was a virtual space walk and journey from the space station back to earth conducted by Tim Peake which was cool.

title: Perfect Japanese fast food
text: I love this place, we eat a lot of japanese food and this place rocks. It's excellent fresh sushi and more. I wish i lived in this restaurant. I'd eat all the profits !

title: Top Table Tapas
text: We ate at the chefs table, watching 4 chefs as they effortlessly created tapas after tapas, including our fantastic meal. We ate a selection of a starter, fish, meat and vegetable dishes and a lovely bottle of white rioja to help it all go down. The staff were lovely, especially our waitress for the evening, who spent time chatting to us between courses.

title: Opening night festivity
text: We found this by accident as a kind woman in the Arts and Crafts centre tipped us off that it was just around the corner. So we walked in and sat and had a couple of drinks asthe place gradually filled up with Mancunians on a tuesday early evening. The concept is great, a wine bar and a brewery, serving local and varied beers. The food looked good although we didn't eat as we had a future plan. Such a great space to hang out.

title: Authenic Turkish food at last in Taunton
text: How helpful these people were on our brief visit to get some delicious takeaway. We aim to go back and sit down to a full on meal there soon

title: Great fresh flavours
text: Dropped in last night for dinner with friends and had a delightful couple of hours. We ordered 4 starters to share around the table and then just two Thalis and some fresh baked breads for main course. The menu is small but we were told it changes every day. The flavours of the food was excellent, not your normal curry house fare. Definitely recommend this restaurant and lovely attentive staff and owners. Thank you Minnie!

title: Always have great beers
text: On the board at the end of the bar, read what's on tap and ready to pour. The beers are always great. A mainly standing bar, there are tables tucked away in other sections of this tardis, as it seems from the outside, very small. Never eaten here but always a good atmosphere and eclectic clientele.

title: Outside but inside
text: I just love the new edition to this restaurant with a now permanent glass box attached to the building. It virtually doubles the size of the place and my favorite table is in this outside space with a cosy inside feel. Of course I came for the food but I had to mention the space and this time I tried the fluffy cheese souffle and a great main course from the special board, venison wellington. The house wines are just fab and because there was 4 of us for dinner we had a carafe of both red and white, perfect.....

title: Fine chinese dining
text: So thankfully we booked in advance and there were 9 of us in total. The place was really buzzing, a friday night and it was full to the gunnels. But with all that was going on the service was great and we ordered starters and drinks and were served really quickly in my opinion. Our host from America very kindly bought a couple of absolutely beautiful bottles of red wine that went so well with everything I was eating. The food is just perfect in ever way, not too fancy but you just cannot fault it. Great night.....

title: Lunch this time and just great
text: We were in town and shopping in Regent Street. I said to my wife 'let's go to Zedel for lunch' and wandered down the street to the restaurant. The place was buzzing but they had space. We sat and I had the special lunch, which was carrot salad and a minute steak burger. I washed it down with a great pint of french beer and it was perfect. I just love the atmosphere of Zedel so much, I'd recommend it to anyone who is passing through Piccadilly Circus

title: fantastic eggs benedict
text: Eating breakfast outside in England when it's a lovely day is superb, really because it's a rare event in my book. So going over the other side of Taunton to check out Silvers Pantry was a great experience, they were full indoors so glad of the nice sunshine and outside tables and chairs. Breakfast with a difference

title: Had a blast at the Summer Fest 2016
text: The onlt time I've been into the park before was a few years ago to the flower show. It was pcked so really didn't get a feel for the space. This time I went early evening to see a couple of bands and the atmosphere was very cool, lots of space and an ideal space for the 4000 other people I was sharing the evening with.

title: What a great spot
text: Half the fun in visiting this place was the walk from town to the restaurant. There was a magic about the crashing waves one side of the promenade and the beach huts in all their different colours on the other side, and the point that you cannot even see the place until you are right in front of it. I also recommend the walk back if you follow the steps behind the building and head upward to a small but fascinating meadow of the history of the universe! but the lunch we ended up ordering was freshly prepared and the service very friendly and we'll visit it again I'm sure of that.

title: Kings of the Cowley Road
text: I visit my home town several times a year to meet up with old school friends and this is one of our favorite restaurants to head to after a couple of beers somewhere in the city. The staff are attentive and the food is delicious.We've always had great meals here, and if you knew some of my friends and how fussy they get, you'd understand why we keep going back there. In fact one friend has been going there Christmas day for the last ten years!!

title: Perfect wine for perfect food
text: I took my wife and friends there for dinner a couple of weeks ago and had a fabulous evening. Katherine looked after us all so well, choosing a wine for each of us, for each course,. with a great skill to compliment Daniel's great dishes. Will return in November and I highly recommend a visit.

title: Lovely staff for breakfast visit
text: They could not have been more helpful. The new menu was great for our visit for breakfast. Scrabbled Eggs and bacon fantastic, the wife's fried eggs perfect, toast and marmalade and tea for two, great price and sat right in the centre of the Garden Centre in front of the roses!

title: We're coming to stay again!
text: Thank you Mathew and Rosie for a lovely room for our 2 night stay. We've enjoyed it so much, we're going to come stay again! Not often we ever do that. Please save some of your Lemon and Tangerine marmalade for November ! see you soon Richard and Carrie

title: Saw some Seals !
text: Okay I get that it is posh fish and chips with a view - a fabulous view at that, (and we watched the seals in the harbour to boot), but the food is quite fatty/greasy, and we were quite 'hurriedly' dealt with, even though the restaurant wasn't full. I'd booked a table for 8.15, (last orders 9.30 so no likelihood of having to give up the table after 2 hours!) Our table wasn't quite ready on arrival and so we asked to have a drink on the terrace to look at the menu, which took a bit of persuading to do as the foh staff really wanted us to go straight to the table. Once we had sat down the waiting staff were lovely. Nice wine list.

title: Summer zingy dishes
text: What a lovely change to have a restaurant that serves such delicious healthy food. The menu was small in selection but as hard to choose from as a huge menu. The courses are multi dimensional, so on the plate there was a real collection of flavours that made it so enjoyable to savour. If you visit Polignano a Mare, visit Mint !

title: City of Church architecture
text: Walking around the old town of Lecce is like going back in time 1000 years. It is so beautifully kept, clean for the most part and the jewel in the crown has to be the Piazza Duomo di Lecce. There is this stunning architecture, outside and inside the church and surrounding buildings and I've added a couple of photos for the first time in my tripadvisor reviews to give a taste of the scene.

title: DOuble portions
text: This place was around the corner from our accommodation in Lecce and looked busy every time we walked passed it, so my wife booked a table for an evening snack. I say snack because we had already had a hearty breakfast and a large lunch, so there wasn't so much room left in my stomach! Anyway we ordered a large plate of meats and cheeses, thinking we could share them together and the platter, when it arrived, I have to admit a little later than I had expected, perhaps 45 minutes, was HUGE. The people on the next table took in a breath of surprise as it landed on our far too small dining table. It did all taste very nice but make sure you're really hungry if you order the large platter. The other issue I had with the restaurant really had nothing to do with the food, but the chairs you had to sit on. Very small wooden slatted garden type chairs, and I had to get up and walk around a bit half way through our visit to get stretch my legs because they were not comfortable at all.

title: Great Local food
text: We ate outside on the patio which was very nice as the sun went down and the daytime views of the old streets and buildings turned a lovely orange gold into the night with the buildings lit up. The food was nicely local, we had chops of lamb, in strange cuts not seen here in the UK and I'd recommend trying the local starter of a chilled bowl of bread, tomato and herbs. It makes a difference from the bread basket for sure. The only issue that got a little tiresome was the local cat population that decided to camp out under the tables and fight for scraps. If this happens every night I would suggest the restaurant issues each customer with their own water pistols.

title: Great location for a spot of lunch
text: Went up to Bristol for the day and concentrated on walking around the dock area. The layout of this restaurant is very friendly, not too squashed up with other tables and the staff were on the go through this busy lunchtime period. We ate from the daily specials board which was very fairly priced, I ate the sardines and my wife had the asia chicken dish. Good portions and swilled down with a craft beer. We're going to come back and try more sometime soon for dinner

title: What a unique place
text:
Loved everything about this place. The staff were amazing, just wanting to enhance the place somehow, and the cave we were allocated was fantastic. Living, even for 12 hours, in a cave, was an experience to remember. We loved the eco ethics of the place with liquid non plastic soaps and candle light, all very well thought out.
The only issue I guess is the fact that the cave was not on a private section of the hotel itself so keeping our door open let anyone passing by on the public walkway that is within the hotel area, take a look into our 'bedroom' !
So a sign of some sort might help avoid unwanted viewing. Even just keeping our window open allowed people to gaze into our room to take a photo!
But the place IS truly amazing, and the breakfast in the morning was delicious with so much to offer.

title: Peaceful hideaway
text: We chose the annexe to the main B and B building, located 50 metres away in a quiet alleyway. The advantage was having a terraced roof to share with another room in the annexe but also a kitchenette, fridge and washing machine. The staff could not have been more helpful, especially on our arrival, as they guided us to the location as it's impossible to drive up to it directly. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Breakfasts were delightful, with eggs any style cooked to order along side the usual continental selections.

title: A surprise in the Abbey
text: We walked from central Polignano a Mare to San Vito along the shore on a quest for a pizza! Been in Italy ten days and still hadn't had one. Before finishing the walk we walked around the port, or Marina into San Vito and arriving in front of the Abbey. There were two good looking restaurants on the picturesque little bay and what looked like a run down pizzeria in front of the huge Abbey. We headed there and walked in to this huge cavernous space, it looks amazing inside and you would not think it from the outside, the original monks stone wheels they used for pressing olives are still there. The staff were fantastic, the menu had a huge range of pizzas, unfortunately only served in the evening! So my wife had a plate of bresaola followed by a fish pasta, whilst I had a plate of fried octopus and spring onions. All of it delicious and washed down with Fiano white wine. What a pleasant surprise, and to cap it off we asked them to call us a cab to take us back to Polignano and the waiter drove us back in his car.....grazie mille Luigi !

title: Five Star raw fish
text: The setting of this beautiful restaurant is out of a movie, it reminds me of the beach clubs around St Tropez, but without the falseness and to be fair not quite the beaches!. So we spent a couple of glorious hours slowly eating our way through two delicious courses of food. My wife had carpaccio of fish for a starter and a tuna steak, mission accomplished..... I had the raw seafood starter platter, sea urchin, oysters, mussels, clams, prawns and langoustines, all raw, OMG it was sensational. Then I had cold medium rare beef salad. A decent bottle of verdeca and coffee and sweet bisciuts to finish off. Highly recommend this place for lunch. Staff very attentive and helpful, very relaxing atmosphere.

title: A pefect stay
text: From the helpful Niko to the perfect continental breakfasts, we loved our too brief 2 night stay at Palazzo Bernardini. Make sure you get Niko, the manager detailed a city map with his great suggestions for great restaurants and tourist visits. One tip I'd like to share is to call in advance if you are in a rental car, as it's not easy finding this place without a city street map. We got close enough in the end for Niko to find us on foot and show us the way but the sat nav couldn't do it.

title: Don't touch with a barge pole
text: Terrible, terrible experience, we stayed there 2 weeks ago for one night, and when we left a brand new tie with label still on it disappeared from the room, we were charged for an extra key, five pounds, we left the other key in the room by accident, funnily that disappeared too. When asking reception for the name of the owners they declined to give a name, when we asked for the name of the manager they declined to give a name. Is this really the way to run a business or treat your clients? OWNERS you should be ashamed of yourselves. The tie cost £20, so why would I make such a fuss if it wasn't for the fact that I feel ripped off. And £5 for a piece of plastic for a key!! It's money for old rope isn't it!! Disgusted...................

title: Many Happy Returns
text: What a great bunch of waiters and waitresses there are here. We settled in and were looked after including a free Birthday treat for our Birthday girl, aged 14, who didn't want the full sing song and cake. The restaurant gave her a surprise bar of Bill's chocalate at the end of our mael, and I for one, loved the Bill's Burger, perfectly cooked, and those sweet potato chips are so tasty. We'll be back.....

title: Love the Regency Room
text:
I was upgraded by the hotel through my travel agent, as we were mob handed, I was in charge and we had booked 30 rooms for 2 nights. So I was on the 22nd floor, a great view of inner city Birmingham and treated to a free bar and nimbles at happy hour. The staff were great the whole of my stay, and the only hassle I had was trying to get the breakfast chef to cook me a runny egg, when I asked for eggs over easy!!
But I'd recommend this place to anyone wanting to have a bit of luxury in the middle of Birmingham as all around this place are trendy bars and restaurants as well as the Barclaycard Arena and Symphony Hall and the new Library

title: Wish I played Golf
text: I must say, I haven't had to walk so far from a reception desk to my room in a very long time. The good thing was I'd been upgraded to a suite, so that was nice, and although i arrived at night, in the morning I had this great view over their lake. It was the Lakeside Suite !! The hotel staff were very pleasant, especially the bar staff, who stayed up very late to let our whole party wind down after a long day.

title: Sunday Roast Superb
text:
First off, been meaning to visit this place since Richard left the Culm Valley Inn. What a great quirky place this is. I didn't mind the tiny bar area at all, and as for the beer, superb. We all four of us had the roast pork for sunday lunch and to a man(woman) loved every mouthful. Great portions, and the glass of red went down well too.
Friendly staff and helpful barman, will be coming back for more, well done Richard!

title: catch of the day
text: A river taxi to the restaurant has to be a great way to start the evening, and a lovely welcome as you go on board to this fantastic barge by the sea. The menu was seafood and fish orientated, as it should be, and I wasn't disappointed by either my starter of giant prawns cocktail or my main course, the catch of the day, a whole plaice. The ber was on form and made my return journey to the mainland both replete and wanting to do it all over again

title: Perfect Indian bliss
text: I'm not a big fan of hot curries but I love, adore indian flavours, and this meal last week was one of the best Indian meals I've ever eaten, it took 45 minutes but with good company, a few popadoms and a couple of beers, time flew and the freshly cooked food arrived, superb, keep it up guys :-) thank you very much chef and all the staff

title: A Christmas must
text: I've been going to the Old parsonage for Christmas lunch for a few years now. My wife and i take my mother and step father there, sometimes with added family members. They were closed in 2013 for 6 months but we went in december and had a lovely meal. If I can criticize one aspect, the seating is a little too cramped together. A couple less tables would I believe, make the experience a little more comfortable. But the standard never fails to impress

title: Perfect Sqid for Christmas
text: I made a reservation for this restaurant with William, the owner, over the internet by email. We were coming to Cassis for our Christmas holidays, and we'd been recommended to try the place out. William was very responsive and once we'd worked out when they were open over the holidays we booked a table for the 22nd. A warm welcome was nice on entry to this small little restaurant up an alleyway behind the harbour. The menu, yet not extensive, had something for everybody and we loved it all, freshly cooked in front of us pretty much by William himself. The service was very friendly, and we left with our stomachs full, and a smile on our faces.

title: Christmas Day at Mama's
text: I've stayed at this hotel before about a year ago and revisited this Christmas. The place was not too busy and the staff were in good spirits as we slowly went through the afternoon haaving a very pleasant lunch.

title: Elegant Hampton dining
text:
We ate outside the first time, with friends, celebrating a birthday. The service was discreet but charming, the food was fantastic. The garden dining area is delightful, modern and unfussy, the fire flies never escape my attention and add to the ambience.
The second time we ate as a group in the basement of the house, the fluke tartare was stunning, the wines as well. This house is old, really old Hampton wise and this is a great example of one that is still cared for with a lot of love and attention.

title: Lobster roll and a beer with a view
text: Great great location, watch the world go by, the boats come in and out while drinking a nice cold beer on the top deck of this restaurant. It's not somewhere to go fine dine, but on a sunny day, a great place to have lunch or brunch and a couple of beers. This was my second time there, and I'd go a third time.

title: I just love this place
text: This is the best 5* dining restaurant in very relaxed surroundings and really is fantastic value in Taunton Somerset. I can't help but recommend this restaurant, co owned and run by Richard Guest and his small team. Anyone coming to Taunton, or passing by.......stop for lunch. The menu changes regularly, and there are always some fabulous 'Specials" on the board. You will not be served by a better Maitre D than Cedric, the co owner, and ask him to choose the wine, I always do, long live Augustus..... I advise booking in advance, it's popular !!!

title: 44 years and still going strong
text: When I was 16 I got a job in the summer holidays working behind the tiny bar at the Trout. The pub was 2 miles from my house and I cycled there everyday. It is still a family favorite with us all and through the years the pub has expanded and improved in many ways. We've spent Christmas there and countless birthday and anniversary lunches and dinners. My favorite time is the summer because it's just a great patio experience, I recommend anyone visiting Oxford to check it out, oh and by the way, the fish swimming below you as you eat lunch, they're not trout !!

title: A rival to the Trout
text: At last somewhere else in North Oxford for a great lunch dinner or just a few great beers. I've visited twice for lunch now, most recently this month for a fabulous roast beef sunday lunch and it was all really great. Interior is stunning, and I can remember the previous look, so it wasn't going to be difficult to get it better but I'm really chuffed at the way it's morphed into the 21st century. The best of luck to them there in Wolvercote, I hope it just gets better and better.

title: Sunday Roast Pork
text: A perfect sunday lunch this weekend, really friendly staff and the best lunch we've had in the area by far since we started visiting north devon 3 years ago. The meal was fresh, hot and good value too. I had a couple of pints of their great Otter Amber Real Ale too. It was the 21st birthday for the landlord too, no wonder he's been there that long, he's obviously doing a great job. Looking forward to going there again soon.

title: Fabulous lunch
text: Just up the road from Mama Shelter hotel, where we were staying and dropped in for lunch with my wife. Had a wonderful surprise as this lovely place has a nice atmosphere and great vin maison. Go there and enjoy

title: funky paris
text:
Great value and a funky restaurant and bar scene, worth a vivit even if you don't stay there.
Under 100 euros for one, and check out the restaurant 200m away called papillon while you're there. The breakfast is fab for 15 euros, as much as you can eat and wifi is free and anywhere in the building

title: tucked away in marseilles
text: Well we arrived together, the ten of us on a large bus and could not get to the hotel, so the hotel sent a van to meet us at a junction nearby to transfer all our luggage. Then a customer relations lady walked us to the hotel along a couple of very narrow streets!!!

title: fish supper
text: The menu was good, with loads of specials and loads of fish choices, which is why we ventured across the bridge from Appledore. Had to sit in the bar area which is a bit shabby but we'll go again and try to get into the restaurant next time.
place: The Boathouse, Beach Bar and Restaurant

title: disappointed
text: Over the years from the mid 70's I have stayed at this lovely hotel. It was a hidden oasis with it's beautiful glass elevator, elegant bar and cosy rooms. I revisited it earlier this year and found a quite tired and unloved version. The rooms need a refit, the showers a clean and the carpets replaced. The hidden side bar has been annexed into a coffee bar now. The location is superb, we flew from Bristol, then took the train directly into central station and then walked the 100 meters to the hotel. You can see the Tivolli Gardens from one side of the hotel, so request a room that side, it's quieter. Another tip is go for a higher floor too for a quiet visit. One very unique feature is their famous brass plaques, displayed in the reception area on a wooden column. Each plaque has the name of a famous bnad or artist that has stayed at the hotel. The list is truly impressive.
